Rakesh wrote:

> Hi J.B.,
> 
> I will explain from the start itself.
> I am using JFCUnit, which is an extension to JUnit.
> I am writing Automated Functional TestCases for our Swing-based GUI.
> And finally I am adding them in one TestSuite.
> 
> My setUp() brings up the GUI and tearDown() brings it down.

This is not what setUp() and tearDown() are for. I think that a custom 
Test Runner, which launches the GUI, then tears the GUI down when the 
JVM shuts down, is a better solution. I think it is better because it 
does not try to do something the JUnit was not designed to do.

> And my Final requirement is to run all these functional TestCases
> repetitively.

Do you mean five times in a row without interference? Or do you mean 
that you should be able to push a "Run Tests" button five times and have 
each test run use the same GUI object? I assumed it was the latter.
